entries.defense: Enforce BIOS password & Secure Boot; audit config changes via fleet tooling; require signed firmware updates.
entries.rationale: Speculative: abuse firmware setup variables to trigger hidden payload paths post-boot.

entries.defense: Monitor Global Atom Table API calls and registry usage; restrict unexpected consumers; detect anomalous inter-process atom usage.
entries.rationale: Cross-process storage & signaling channel; research shows viable variants without common IOCs.

entries.defense: Restrict unsigned drivers; enable HVCI/Device Guard; audit kernel driver load events and named device objects.
entries.rationale: Legacy/compat subsystems and virtual drivers surface risky call paths.

entries.defense: Egress policy on metadata endpoints; metadata proxy with auth; anomaly detection on call volume/headers.
entries.rationale: Noisy but feasible to mask exfil/command via internal service endpoints.

entries.defense: Disable unused radios; enforce BT policy; monitor pairing events and unusual HID traffic patterns.
entries.rationale: Short-range but stealthy C2 via HID profiles.
